moves.1. d4 e6 2. Nf3: I thought he was going to paly Queens gambit which i respond e6 then d5 or c5 in any order.
moves.2... Nf6 3. e3: Blocking his dark squared bishop would be a mistake. The block wasn't forced
moves.3... c5: My favourite move. Attacking the center and if he was to recapture I ould develop my dark squared bishop and castle the next move.
moves.4. Qd3: Not a particularly good move. He should've tried to develop his light squared bishop first
moves.5. c3: He didn't need to reinforce it yet,
moves.6. h3: I wasn't really planning t move Ng4
moves.6... Bd6: Getting ready to castle. This is like Queens Gambit except for black. I have developed the initiative early in the game. HE could capture So i would lose tempo.
moves.7. b3: Preparing for a c4 pawn push or to prevent my push to c4 which i wouldn't do because it would easily be countered.
moves.7... Bd7 8. a4 Qb6: A powerful square for the queen to be on
moves.9. Ra3: ? Mistake. I will win pawn at least.I could Capture on d4 and if he were to capture back i would capture his rook. If he were to move his rook i would capture e3 and when he captures back i would capture b3 althoug my queen might get trapped.
moves.10... Bxa3 11. Bxa3 Ne4 12. Bc5: Attacking the queen I could've gained a pawnby capturing the bishop with the knight but i opted not to.
moves.12... Qc7 13. Nfd2: Despertely trying to rid my knight. Why not with the queenside knight?
moves.14. Qxd2: Capture with queen. I thought he would with the knight
moves.14... b6: The bishop prohibited me from castling so i try to push it back a little and hopefully remove it off the diagonal.
moves.15. Bb4 Nxb4: Material is gained no matter what. If he takes my knight then i could come to c1 and check his king and fork the knight winning a piece at least.
moves.16. Nc3: He realises this and finally develops his knight
moves.16... O-O: I castle FINALLY to develop my rook. I castled on a free move when there wasn't much to do
moves.17. Bd3: Why would he wasn't to exchange with me? I'm in a winning position and it's not smart to exchange.
moves.18. Qxd3 Rac8: Striking C3 and developing my rook.
moves.19. Kd2: Only move in which he could hold on to material. He could've moved his knight to d1 which wouldn't be so bad
moves.19... Rfe8 20. f4: Since his king had already moved he didn't need his kingside anymore.
moves.20... Red8 21. Rc1 Qd6: Just tryin to stay out of a queen attack
moves.23... Be8: I moved back just incase his pawn storm worked. I would move f6 or f5 and my bishop would be a supporting piece.
moves.25. h4 Rdc8 26. h5: MOving his king to d2 was a mistake because He had a Queen and rook defending a piece while i had a rook and queen. 2 defenders beat 2 attackers.
moves.26... Rc7xc3: I exchange and now i know his pawnstorm will fail
moves.31. g5 Ke7 32. Kd2: Last attempts to destroy my king side.
moves.32... a5 33. Kc1: Obviously a mistake from his low morale
